change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 119/2011, effective June 28, 2011.

definition.def: means, with respect to a public utility's electricity rates, the average monthly bill for electricity, but not any other terms and conditions of those rates.

section.sectiontext: In a report to be provided to the commission under section 43 (1.1) of the Act, the authority must do all of the following:

paragraph.paragraphtext: include a comparison with at least one public utility in each of at least fifteen other jurisdictions in North America, including all of the following:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the provinces of Alberta, Quebec, Ontario and Manitoba;
the states of Washington, Oregon and California;

paragraph.paragraphtext: compare the previous year's applicable rates for residential, commercial and industrial customers with similar rates of the public utilities referred to in paragraph (a);
express the monetary comparisons in Canadian currency;
provide the authority's previous 5 years of applicable rates.
